tech_news.title: Nintendo Today! updated to version 2.3.0, patch notes - Nintendo Everything
tech_news.description: The Nintendo Today! mobile app has been updated to version 2.3.0. Users should be seeing the update roll out by now. This update adds support for the app in a few new regions. You can see the full list of patches here: Nintendo Today! 2.3.0 update out now, pa…

tech_news.title: Google Clock 8.5 rolling out ‘swipe to dismiss’ for alarms - 9to5Google
tech_news.description: Version 8.5 of Google Clock for Android was released last week and it’s rolling out the ability to dismiss alarms by swiping.

tech_news.title: NVIDIA’s Laptop Chips, After a Long-Awaited Build-Up, Are Set to Debut This Year By Q2; N1/N1X SoCs to Challenge x86 Supremacy - Wccftech
tech_news.description: NVIDIA plans to release ARM-based laptop chips as soon as this year, featuring the N1/N1X variants that are expected to dominate.

tech_news.title: Firehound is a huge repository of App Store apps exposing data from millions of users - 9to5Mac
tech_news.description: An effort led by security research lab CovertLabs is actively uncovering troves of (mostly) AI-related apps that leak and expose user data.

tech_news.title: How to take pictures of the Northern Lights with Google Pixel and other Android phones - 9to5Google
tech_news.description: The Northern Lights are the most visible they've been in decades, and you can capture it with a picture from Android or Google Pixel phones.
